about_app_section_1: The Spectral Sampler is a utility app made available in conjunction with the suite of Imagery Explorer apps from ArcGIS Living Atlas. This app can be used to collect and export spectral signatures of user-defined land cover classes using either Landsat Level-2 or Sentinel-2 Level-2A multispectral imagery. The spectral sampler was used to train the classes found in the Spectral Profile analysis tool in the Landsat Explorer and the Sentinel-2 Explorer apps.
how_it_works_section_1_description: Select either Landsat or Sentinel-2 as your multispectral imagery source.
how_it_works_section_2_description: Define a land classification type for your collection (e.g., Bare Soil, Coniferous Forest, etc.).
how_it_works_section_3_description: Choose satellite scenes for your target date(s) to collect your spectral samples.
how_it_works_section_4_description: When finished with collection, download your spectral samples to CSV.
purpose_description: The goal of this tool is to make the creation of land cover training datasets as efficient and transparent as possible. By simplifying the process of sourcing and organizing labeled imagery, we aim to support better classification outcomes across a range of remote sensing and geospatial applications.
